access.notes: Static HTML compliance hub with Bootstrap accordion. EHI Export Documentation is section 6 of 7. Content is in the DOM even when collapsed.

export_format.description: Each product uses a different export format. Veradigm EHR exports JSON files in a ZIP with folder hierarchy (Attachments, Scanned Documents, Transcriptions, Discrete Data). ePrescribe exports TSV files plus chart extract documents in a ZIP. FollowMyHealth exports FHIR R4 NDJSON bundles in a ZIP. Practice Management exports pipe-delimited text files. Veradigm View (Practice Fusion) exports TSV files.

documentation.notes: 5 PDFs (for EHR, ePrescribe, FollowMyHealth v1+v2, Practice Management v1+v2) plus 1 HTML site (Veradigm View with 87 subpages). All products provide field-level detail with field names, data types, and descriptions.

clinical.evidence: Extensive clinical data across all products. EHR: Demographics, History (diagnoses, medications), Vitals, Diagnosis, Medications, Procedures, Lab Orders, Immunization, Care Plans, Flowsheet, Questionnaire. ePrescribe: Allergies, Demographics, Diagnosis, Historical Medications, Prescriptions. FMH: AllergyIntolerance, Condition, DiagnosticReport, FamilyMemberHistory, Immunization, Medication, MedicationRequest, Observation, Patient, Procedure. View: 87 TSV files covering demographics, conditions, diagnoses, encounters, medications, labs, immunizations, vitals, etc.

secure_messages.evidence: EHR: Message domain with SavedMessageResults.json, SavedMessages.json, SavedWebMessages.json. FMH: Communication resource (maps to HL7 FHIR Communication). View: Messaging section with patient-messages.tsv, patient-message-recipients.tsv, patient-message-attachments.tsv.

billing_financial.evidence: Practice Management: Detailed claim information fields (chargeAmount, paymentAdjTotal, claimNumber), ailment fields, ambulance fields, drug fields, anesthesia fields, dental fields. View: Billing and insurance section with patient-superbills.tsv, superbill-diagnosis.tsv, superbill-procedures.tsv, superbill-procedure-modifiers.tsv, superbill-events.tsv, patient-guarantor.tsv. FMH: Invoice resource with billing data.

insurance_coverage.evidence: ePrescribe: Insurance.tsv with detailed insurance fields. EHR: Insurance-related fields within demographics. View: patient-insurances.tsv, patient-insurance-eligibilities.tsv, superbill-insurances.tsv. Practice Management: Insurance fields within claims.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: FMH: Appointment FHIR resource. View: patient-appointments.tsv under Demographics section. EHR: Encounter domain with Encounter.json.

documents_images.evidence: EHR: ZIP contains Attachments folder, Scanned Documents folder, Transcriptions folder, plus ChartAttachments.json and ScannedDocuments.json with metadata. FMH: DocumentReference FHIR resource. View: patient-documents.tsv, patient-encounter-documents.tsv, patient-lab-order-documents.tsv, patient-lab-result-documents.tsv.

audit_trails.evidence: No explicit audit trail or access log tables found across any product documentation. Searched for audit, access log, tracking, who viewed — no dedicated audit data export documented.

downloaded_files.description: Veradigm EHR EHI Export Data Guide v1. 89 pages. Covers JSON export format with folder hierarchy. 50 JSON files across 14 clinical domains: Demographics, History, Vitals, Diagnosis, Medications, Procedures, Lab Orders, Referrals, Flowsheet, Risk Management, Contact, Encounter, Reason For Visit, Immunization, Message, Questionnaire, Care Plans. Includes Attachments, Scanned Documents, and Transcriptions folders.

Veradigm ePrescribe EHI Export Data Guide v1. 22 pages. Covers TSV export format. 6 TSV files: Allergies.tsv, Demographics.tsv, Diagnosis.tsv, Historical Medications.tsv, Insurance.tsv, Prescriptions.tsv. Also includes chart extract documents.

FollowMyHealth EHI Export Data Guide v2. 29 pages. Exports FHIR R4 NDJSON bundles. 18 supported FHIR resources: Account, AllergyIntolerance, Appointment, Bundle, Communication, Condition, DiagnosticReport, DocumentReference, Encounter, FamilyMemberHistory, Immunization, Invoice, Medication, MedicationRequest, Observation, Patient, Practitioner, Procedure.
FollowMyHealth EHI Export Data Guide v1. 21 pages. Same FHIR R4 NDJSON format. Older version of the v2 guide.

Veradigm Practice Management (non ONC certified) EHI Data Export File Reference Guide v2. 20 pages. Pipe-delimited export format. Covers claim information, ailment information, ambulance information, drug information, anesthesia information, and dental information fields. V2 adds ambulance/drug/anesthesia/dental field appendices.
Veradigm Practice Management (non ONC certified) EHI Data Export File Reference Guide v1. 17 pages. Covers claim and ailment information fields.

Veradigm View (formerly Practice Fusion) EHI Export Documentation V6 index page. Lists 87 TSV files organized into 8 sections: Demographics (10 files), Patient (2 files), Clinical (31 files), Billing and insurance (13 files), Medications and prescriptions (12 files), Labs (16 files), Referrals (2 files), Messaging (3 files). Each TSV file links to a subpage with field-level detail (Field Name, Data type, Field Description). TSV export format.

issues: Multiple products with completely different export formats (JSON, TSV, FHIR NDJSON, pipe-delimited) — no unified approach
Veradigm EHR documentation is v1 only (Nov 2023) with no updates since
ePrescribe documentation is v1 only (Nov 2023) with no updates since
No audit trail data documented in any product's export
No sample/example export files or developer tools provided
FollowMyHealth uses FHIR R4 resources — this is closer to a FHIR re-export than a raw database dump, though it does include Invoice and Communication resources beyond USCDI
Practice Management explicitly labeled 'non ONC certified' but provides EHI documentation anyway
FollowMyHealth v1 served from fhir.followmyhealth.com returns HTTP 405 for HEAD requests (works with GET)
summary: Veradigm provides comprehensive EHI export documentation across 5 products through a well-organized compliance hub page with accordion navigation. Each product uses a different export format: Veradigm EHR exports JSON in ZIP archives (89-page guide, 50 files across 14 clinical domains including messages, attachments, scanned documents); ePrescribe exports TSV files (6 tables); FollowMyHealth exports FHIR R4 NDJSON (18 resources including Communication and Invoice); Veradigm View exports TSV files (87 tables with field-level HTML documentation — the most detailed). The View documentation is notably thorough with dedicated HTML pages for each TSV file showing field names, data types, and descriptions. Coverage includes clinical data, secure messages, billing/superbills, insurance, appointments, and documents, but no audit trails are documented in any product.
